home-subtitle: Explore the connections and themes around the body and soul in medieval literature through an interactive visualization.
home-about-us: Welcome to the Analysis Dashboard for the Anatomy in the Middle Ages (A.D.A.M.), a collaborative effort born from the Body&Soul project. Our interdisciplinary team consists of dedicated researchers from the Faculty of Humanities at the University of Lisbon—including the Center for History, the Center for Philosophy, Artis - Institute of Art History, and the Center for Anglo-American Studies—and engineering students from Instituto Superior Técnico. Our mission is to explore the intricate connections and themes of the body and soul in medieval literature, presenting the original study through an interactive visualization platform aimed at making the research more accessible and engaging for both academics and enthusiasts alike.
adam: Analysis Dashboard for the Anatomy in the Middle Ages
home-map-title: Localities and centuries present in the medieval texts
information-map: Hover on a mark for more information.
information-legend-map: Legend represents the total amount of occurrences for each textual pair location-century.
information-pyramid:
Hover on a bar for more information.
Click on the icon on the right to change grouping types.
information-heatmap:
Hover on a cell for more information. Click on it to change to the detailed view.
The categories can be dragged via the filters on the left.
information-imp: Hover on a cell for more information. Choose two people ('subject') to compare their characteristics. Shared terms will be highlighted for easy comparison. Each term is accompanied by the number of occurrences in the database when hovered.
information-network:
Hover over the connections or cells for more information. In applicable cases, the 'About whom' links appear associated with and originating from the corresponding 'With whom' link. The number of interactions is proportional to the link's thickness.
Attention: Zoom out to see all connections.
information-database: Select the columns of the database to be seen.
filter-tooltip-categories:
Select two categories to compare on the graph by dragging them over the comparison area.
Note: You can only compare two categories at a time.
filter-tooltip-agent: Defines whether the 'subject' field is doing the action (Active) or if it is receiving it (Passive).
filter-tooltip-intention: Defines the intention associated with the action.
filter-tooltip-value: Defines whether the action is literal or symbolic.
filter-tooltip-nature: Defines the nature of the act and subject.
filter-tooltip-supernatural_type: Defines the type of supernatural act, wether 'Nature' is 'supernatural' or not.
filter-tooltip-dimension: Defines the dimension of the body.
network-tooltip-see-more: Click on this link to see the corresponding excerpts.
network-about-info: Represents when person A talks ABOUT person B
network-with-info: Represents when person A talks WITH person B
pyramid-separate: How are the different sexes perceived?
